articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Coronavirus in Ireland - a timeline
articles.description: On 16 January RTÉ News published an article online about a mystery virus gripping the Chinese city of Wuhan - now the novel coronavirus has spread to nearly every country in the world and Ireland is waging its own battle against the illness.
articles.content:
A report about a mysterious pneumonia outbreak in the Chinese city of Wuhan is published on RTÉ News.
The virus first emerged in China in late December.
Symptoms may include a cough, a shortness of breath, breathing difficulties, or a high temperature.
The… [+65 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: 39 more coronavirus deaths confirmed in UK
articles.description: A further 39 people have died in England after testing positive for the coronavirus, bringing the total number of confirmed deaths in the country to 167, the UK's National Health Service has said.
articles.content:
A further 40 people have died across the UK after testing positive for the coronavirus, bringing the total number of confirmed deaths in the country to 167, the UK's National Health Service has said.
The patients who died were aged between 50 and 99 and had … [+4518 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: Wetherspoon warns on profit due to coronavirus
articles.description: Pub operator J D Wetherspoon has today cancelled its dividend and said profit would be below market expectations as long as the coronavirus outbreak continues.
articles.content:
Pub operator J D Wetherspoon has today cancelled its dividend and said profit would be below market expectations as long as the coronavirus outbreak continues. 
Sales have dropped at a significantly higher rate after the UK government asked people to avoid p… [+1110 chars]

articles.author: RTÉ News
articles.title: M&S warns of 'severe impact' from coronavirus
articles.description: Retailer Marks & Spencer said today that trading over the next 9-12 months in its clothing and homewares and international businesses was likely to be "severely impacted" by the coronavirus.
articles.content:
Retailer Marks & Spencer said today that trading over the next 9-12 months in its clothing and homewares and international businesses was likely to be "severely impacted" by the coronavirus. 
It said it was unable to provide meaningful guidance on future… [+73 chars]
